page.title: 14SPICE FACTORY - PAISLEY
page.content:
The factory is ninety years old, covers 38,0000 square feet and employs one hundred people. Before being a spice factory the building was used for soup making, potato crisps and at one time was a bakery. The main products are Camp Coffee, a variety of relishes, cranberry sauce and spices. The ingredients come to Paisley from all over the world, being unloaded at Grangemouth and Port Glasgow where they are transferred to trucks to be brought to the factory by road. Corn from the U.S.A., sugar from the West Indies and chickory from Belgium.
It costs Â£8,700 per day to run the factory and the annual wage bill is Â£750,000. Each year 7,000 cases of coffee (24 bottle per case), 30,000 cases of relish (12 bottle in each), and 50,000 trays of spices are sold.
